column5: Probably in it's fourth year of life Johnny.  Amazing that they can grow so big so quickly eh?  I believe I once read that by mid-august they are capable of putting on 1lb/week of body weight in preparation for their spawning run.  Tony
Wow guys thanks for all the replies,and yes i need another one just like it next week for the salmon derby,it would have made the top 10 for sure.....cheers
Shawn I only dream of catching a prize like that.Nice to live so close to Salmon fishing.WTG Man  MTP
OMG Shawn, amazing catch... WTG  Cheers,  Jen
Nice fish FD lets hope we both get into the Lunds this summer ..i could use a 4th boat ..great report ..Fishmaster
4 years old ..
thats one hawg!

Well i hit the water at 4:45am....and it was a chilly start to the day but i had a good feeling ,because the water temps have set up nice from bowmanville to oshawa,so myself and my friend droped lines just west of the darlington nuke plant in 70ft of water,about 35ft down....marked a few fish,and within a few mins i picked up about a 12lb king,on the michigan stinger spoon,and then nothing for about 1hr1,bang,the dipsey rod fires off,and i pulled another 8-10lb king,caught him on the same spoon,about 45ft down,then the long wait.....talked to my bud and a few other boats on the VHF,radio and there was a few fish being caught but not to many big ones a few just around the 20lb mark....by this time i have put a monkey puke fly/and a dipsey/spin doctor,off the wire rod,on setting #3 111ft back.and was running about 45ft down..and bang...it goes crazy the fish hit so hard i had a difficult time getting the rod out of the holder,as line is burnning of the reel big time....zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz...well the fish stops running at 320ft out,man the fight is on,and about 20mins later he is at the boat.and wouldnt you know it,the fish just wont come to the net,its very hard trying to drive and fight a big fish like that all at the same time,and net the thing as wellhe keeps making runs under the boat so i end up driving in circles to avoid a break off,this salmon does not want anything to do with my boat what a tug of war...man what a big fish...glad i had my big salmon net or i would be in big trouble,so i net the fish,and do my thing with the measuring & weigh the salmon he hit the scales at 30.10lbs and 43inches long....yeeehhaaaaaa.....so we headed to the marina and got some pics and chatted up for a while and that was my day salmon fishing out of port darlington.and thats the big fish of the year so far...the fishing is awesome right now,so here is my pics and my entry for team 3 fin-chasers...enjoy
HOLY ________!NICE CATCH MAN!
Very nice!
Thar' she blows.....great catch!
holy crap shawn! that thing is massive.. congrats shawn and yay team 3!!!
awesome fish,congrats

Its sounds like you were alone.  If so, that is an amazing feat FnD!! Great story and what a PIG!! Thanks for sharing.
WOW!! now that is one big fish!   awesome
Well done!!!
amazing fish man..great report, great pics, and thanks for sharing
ahh mannn!!!!!!!!!  i was savin that fish and nowya had to go and catch em before he beefed up for the salmon  derby!!!!.....ohh well nice little one anyway
Great Fish, and story.
Nice!!  ... wow....  sweet...
Wow, what a fish!
Nice fish Fishindevil, I was out on Saturday at Bluffers and we went 3 for 5 plus a shaker. One was 20 and one of the fish we lost was big and broke us off.
WOW !!!!!!  Congrats on that monster catch Shawn, she's a real beaut !!!!
Man, what a nice fish!  Congrats! dk

Awesome fish dude! But a week too early!!!  That fish would have made the top 10 in the Great Ontario Salmon Derby.  Congrats. Tony
SWEET looking fish!!!  Congrats!!!
